capabilities.name: Act with Integrity
capabilities.description: The role requires adherence to legislative and regulatory requirements, ensuring compliance in archival practices.

capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Must engage and communicate strategic advice on records management to various stakeholders.

capabilities.name: Deliver Results
capabilities.description: Responsible for the development and implementation of archival systems, ensuring operational and historical records are preserved.

capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: Needs to manage competing priorities while developing and implementing archival and records management strategies.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: Requires strategic input into records and information management, including IT integration, to solve complex archival challenges.

capabilities.name: Demonstrate Accountability
capabilities.description: Accountable for ensuring compliance with legislative requirements and managing the full lifecycle of records.

capabilities.name: Technology
capabilities.description: Expertise in using EDRMS and applying disposal schedules, as well as knowledge of emerging technologies in information management.

capabilities.name: Project Management
capabilities.description: Involves leading the development and implementation of archival systems and training programs.

capabilities.name: Manage Reform and Change
capabilities.description: Promotes and delivers archival training programs, supporting change in records management practices.

skills.name: Archival and Records Management
skills.description: Expertise in managing the lifecycle of records, including retention, disposal, and transfer.

skills.name: Stakeholder Engagement
skills.description: Ability to engage with and communicate effectively to stakeholders at various levels.

skills.name: Legislative Compliance
skills.description: Knowledge of the State Records Act 1998, AS ISO 15489, and other relevant compliance frameworks.

skills.name: EDRMS Usage
skills.description: Experience using Electronic Document and Records Management Systems, preferably Compass, Content Manager.

generalRole.title: Senior Archivist
generalRole.description: A Senior Archivist in the NSW Government is responsible for leading the development and implementation of archival systems, ensuring compliance with legislative requirements, and enhancing access to documentation across the organisation. This role requires advanced capabilities in integrity, communication, results delivery, planning, problem-solving, accountability, technology, and project management.
